I.name: Rage Gene
description: {{sbc|Innate - Rage Gene:}} {{ci|Gnar|Mini Gnar}} generates {{pp|4;7;11|1 to 11}} ''{{ai|Rage Gene|Gnar|Rage}}'' over 2 seconds upon dealing or receiving [[damage]]. Against non-[[champion]]s, [[basic attack]]s and ''{{ai|Boomerang Throw|Gnar}}'' instantly generate{{ft|{{pp|4*0.125;7*0.125;11*0.125|1 to 11|round=false}} ''Rage''.|{{fd|12.5%}} of the amount.}} Against champions, ''{{ai|Boomerang Throw|Gnar}}'' instantly generates{{ft|{{pp|4*0.25;7*0.25;11*0.25|1 to 11|round=false}} ''Rage'',|25% of the amount,}}and basic attacks instantly generate{{ft|{{pp|4*0.5;7*0.5;11*0.5|1 to 11|round=false}}.|50% of the amount.}}''{{ai|Boomerang Throw|Gnar}}'' can only generate ''Rage'' once per cast, and grants ''Rage'' based on the first enemy hit. '''Gnar's''' ''Rage'' decays if he has not dealt or taken damage in the last 13 seconds.

At maximum ''Rage'', '''Gnar's''' abilities are switched to {{cis|Mega Gnar}} abilities for 4 seconds. Casting one of '''Mega Gnar's''' abilities will cause him to transform into {{ci|Mega Gnar}}, else he will transform automatically after the 4 seconds have elapsed.

'''Gnar's''' {{ci|Mega Gnar|Mega}} form lasts for 15 seconds, with his ''Rage'' bar depleting as an indication of remaining time. ''Rage cannot be generated while in this form.'' Afterwards, '''Gnar''' returns to {{ci|Gnar|Mini Gnar}}, retaining his {{sti|health|{{as|'''current''' percentage health}}}} and becoming too [[File:Rage Gene 4.png|20px]] ''tired'' to generate ''Rage'' for 15 seconds.
'''Gnar''' gains different stat bonuses based on whether he is in ''{{ai|Mini Gnar|Gnar|Mini}}'' or ''{{ai|Mega Gnar|Gnar|Mega}}'' form. Both of '''Gnar's''' forms share their ability cooldowns.
I.descriptionHtml:
Innate - Rage Gene: Mini Gnar generates 1 to 11 ‒ undefined Gnar's Rage over 2 seconds upon dealing or receiving damage. Against non-champions, basic attacks and Gnar's Boomerang Throw instantly generate Against champions, Gnar's Boomerang Throw instantly generatesand basic attacks instantly generateGnar's Boomerang Throw can only generate Rage once per cast, and grants Rage based on the first enemy hit. Gnar's Rage decays if he has not dealt or taken damage in the last 13 seconds.
At maximum Rage, Gnar's abilities are switched to Mega Gnar's abilities for 4 seconds. Casting one of Mega Gnar's abilities will cause him to transform into Mega Gnar, else he will transform automatically after the 4 seconds have elapsed.
Gnar's Mega form lasts for 15 seconds, with his Rage bar depleting as an indication of remaining time. Rage cannot be generated while in this form. Afterwards, Gnar returns to Mini Gnar, retaining his current percentage health and becoming too File:Rage Gene 4.png tired to generate Rage for 15 seconds.
Gnar gains different stat bonuses based on whether he is in Gnar's Mini or Gnar's Mega form. Both of Gnar's forms share their ability cooldowns.
I.notes:
* The ''Rage'' generated upon dealing or receiving damage occurs over 2 seconds with 4 ticks every {{fd|0.5}} seconds. It also does not stack but instead refreshes with subsequent applications (of dealing or receiving damage).
* The bonus rage generation on basic attacks counts as an {{tip|on-hit}} effect, and is triggered by {{ii|Runaan's Hurricane}} and {{ii|Guinsoo's Rageblade}}.
* In-game, the value on the ''Rage'' bar always displays rounded down to the nearest integer.
* {{cis|Mega Gnar}} gained health is not affected by [[healing]] modifiers such as {{tip|Grievous Wounds}} and those from [[item]]s and [[rune]]s.
* When returning to {{ci|Gnar|Mini Gnar}}, '''Gnar''' will only retain his current health percentage, not current health total.
** This is intentional to prevent '''Gnar''' from simply triggering {{ai|Rage Gene 3|Gnar|Rage Gene}} in order to heal himself over time.
* '''Gnar's''' abilities share {{sti|cooldowns}} across forms.
* The final stats, after {{ai|Rage Gene 3|Gnar|Rage Gene}} being applied, can be seen on '''Mini Gnar's''' and '''Mega Gnar's''' respective data template, in the [[Gnar|front page]].
** '''Mini Gnar''' gains {{as|{{pp|key=%|5.5+({{ccd|Gnar|as_lvl}}-{{ccd|Mega Gnar|as_lvl}})*(x-1)*(0.7025+0.0175*(x-1))|formula=5.5 base + {{#expr:{{ccd|Gnar|as_lvl}}-{{ccd|Mega Gnar|as_lvl}}}} growth}}|attack speed}} {{as|'''bonus''' attack speed}}.

Q1.name: Boomerang Throw
description:
{{sbc|Active:}} '''Gnar''' throws a boomerang in a line in the target direction that deals {{as|physical damage}} to enemies in its path and {{tip|slow|slows}} them for 2 seconds.

After reaching its maximum range or hitting an enemy, the boomerang flies back toward '''Gnar''' based on his current movement, dealing 50% damage to subsequent targets.
Each enemy can only be hit once. Catching the boomerang while it is returning back {{sti|cdr|refunds}} 40% of the ability's '''maximum''' cooldown.
Q1.descriptionHtml:
Active: Gnar throws a boomerang in a line in the target direction that deals physical damage to enemies in its path and slows them for 2 seconds.

After reaching its maximum range or hitting an enemy, the boomerang flies back toward Gnar based on his current movement, dealing 50% damage to subsequent targets.
Each enemy can only be hit once. Catching the boomerang while it is returning back refunds 40% of the ability's maximum cooldown.
leveling: {{st|Physical Damage|{{ap|5 to 165}} {{as|(+ 115% AD)}}|Reduced Damage|{{ap|5/2 to 165/2}} {{as|(+ {{fd|57.5}}% AD)}}}}{{st|Slow|{{ap|15 to 35}}%}}

effects.str:
• Physical Damage: (+ 115% AD)
  • Reduced Damage: (+ 57.5% AD)
  • Slow: %

W1.name: Hyper
description: {{sbc|Passive:}} '''Gnar's''' [[basic attack]]s {{tip|on-hit}} and [[champion ability|abilities]] apply a [[stack]] of ''Hyper'' to affected enemies for {{fd|3.5}} seconds, stacking up to 3 times, with the duration refreshing upon applying the second stack.

Upon applying 3 stacks to a target, the stacks are consumed to deal {{as|'''bonus''' magic damage}}, capped at 300 against {{tip|monsters}}, and grant '''Gnar''' {{pp|type = [[File:GNAR!.png|20px|border]] ''GNAR!'s'' rank|key=%|20 to 80 for 4|0 to 3|formula = 20% + 20% per GNAR!'s rank|color=ms}} {{sti|ms|{{as|'''bonus''' movement speed}}}} that decays over 3 seconds.
'''Gnar''' gains ''Hyper's'' {{sti|ms|{{as|'''bonus''' movement speed}}}} when he leaves {{ci|Mega Gnar|Mega}} form.
W1.descriptionHtml:
Passive: Gnar's basic attacks on-hit and champion ability apply a stack of Hyper to affected enemies for 3.5 seconds, stacking up to 3 times, with the duration refreshing upon applying the second stack.
Upon applying 3 stacks to a target, the stacks are consumed to deal bonus magic damage, capped at 300 against monsters, and grant Gnar 0 to 3 ‒ undefined bonus movement speed that decays over 3 seconds.
Gnar gains Hyper's bonus movement speed when he leaves Mega form.
leveling: {{st|Bonus Magic Damage|{{ap|0 to 40}} {{as|(+ {{ap|6 to 14}}% of target's '''maximum''' health)}} {{as|(+ 100% AP)}}}}
W1.notes: * The bonus movement speed's duration refreshes whenever '''Gnar''' would receive it (by hitting a target three times again).

effects.str: • Bonus Magic Damage: (+ % of target's maximum health) (+ 100% AP)

st_slices: (+ % of target's maximum health) (+ 100% AP)

E1.name: Hop
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Gnar''' {{tip|dash|leaps}} to the target location, and upon arrival gains {{sti|{{as|'''bonus''' attack speed}}}} for 6 seconds.
If '''Gnar''' lands on a unit he will {{tip|dash|bounce}} 500 units further in the same direction.
Landing on an enemy deals them {{as|physical damage}} and {{tip|slow|slows}} them by 80% for {{fd|0.5}} seconds.
'''Gnar''' will not bounce if he is {{tip|immobilize|immobilized}}, excluding from {{tip|sleep}}{{bug}}, during the first leap.
''{{ai|Boomerang Throw|Gnar}} can be cast during the dash. Hop will cast at max range if cast beyond that.''
E1.descriptionHtml:
Active: Gnar leaps to the target location, and upon arrival gains bonus attack speed for 6 seconds.
If Gnar lands on a unit he will bounce 500 units further in the same direction.
Landing on an enemy deals them physical damage and slows them by 80% for 0.5 seconds.
Gnar will not bounce if he is immobilized, excluding from sleepUnknown value: bug, during the first leap.
Gnar's Boomerang Throw can be cast during the dash. Hop will cast at max range if cast beyond that.
E1.notes:
* ''Hop'' does not allow '''Gnar''' to bounce off wards.
* ''Hop'' does not grant '''bonus''' attack speed if used to transform.
* If ''Hop'' generates ''Rage'' to maximum and '''Gnar''' bounces off an enemy, he may cast {{ai|GNAR!|Gnar}} during the bounce.
